i1.blurb: Olaf's Attack Speed is increased by 1% for each 1% of his Health he is missing.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Olaf''' gains {{as|{{as|{{pp|11|type='''missing''' health|key=%|0 to 100|key1=%|0 to 100|formula=1% per 1% missing health}}|health}} {{sti|'''bonus''' attack speed}}|attack speed}}.
i1.name: Berserker Rage

q1.blurb: Olaf throws an axe into the ground at a target location, dealing damage to enemies it passes through and slowing their Movement Speed. If Olaf picks up the axe, the ability's {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 4.5 seconds.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Olaf''' throws an axe to the target location, dealing {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} to all enemies it passes through and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for {{pp|type=distance traveled|9|1.5 to 2.5|400 to 1000|formula=1.5+(0.125 per 75 units traveled)}} seconds.
The axe remains at the target location for a duration equal to the {{sti|cooldown}}. '''Olaf''' reduces the cooldown of ''Undertow'' by {{fd|4.5}} seconds upon retrieving an axe.
q1.name: Undertow
notes: * The timer for how long an axe stays on the ground starts upon landing, so it is possible to throw another axe before grabbing the one from the ground.
* ''Olaf'' cannot pick up an enemy twin's ''Undertow'' (unlike {{ci|Draven}} with {{ai|Spinning Axe|Draven}}).

w1.blurb: Olaf's Attack Speed is increased, he gains Life Steal and has increased healing from all sources based on how much Health he is missing.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} For 6 seconds, '''Olaf''' gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}}, '''bonus''' {{sti|life steal}}, and {{as|{{pp|11|type='''missing''' health|key=%|0 to 50|key1=%|0 to 100|formula=0.5% per 1% missing health}}|health}} enhanced {{tip|heal|healing}} from all sources.
w1.name: Vicious Strikes
notes: * ''Vicious Strikes'' has no cast time and it does not interrupt ''Olaf's'' previous orders.
* ''Vicious Strikes' ''enhanced healing stacks multiplicatively with {{ii|Spirit Visage}}.

e1.blurb: Olaf attacks with such force that it deals true damage to his target and himself, refunding the Health cost if he destroys the target.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Olaf''' deals {{tip|true damage|{{as|true damage}}}} to the target enemy.

''Reckless Swing'' {{tip|heals}} '''Olaf''' for {{as|{{sti|health|its health cost}}}} if it kills its target and its {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 1 second every time '''Olaf''' lands a [[basic attack]].
e1.name: Reckless Swing
notes: * ''Olaf'' will pay ''Reckless Swing's'' cost (30% total damage) even if the target is not damaged.
* ''Reckless Swing'' can be cast at any health amount but ''Olaf'' will never drop below 1 current health (effectively being able to cast for free at that value).
* ''Reckless Swing's'' health refund is considered {{tip|heal|healing}} therefore it is affected by {{ai|Vicious Strikes|Olaf}} and {{ii|Spirit Visage}}.
* ''Reckless Swing'' will cancel if Olaf loses sight of his target during cast time.

r1.blurb: Olaf temporarily becomes immune to disables.
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Olaf''' gains {{sti|armor|{{as|'''bonus''' armor}}}} and {{sti|mr|{{as|'''bonus''' magic resistance}}}} while ''Ragnarok'' is inactive.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Olaf''' removes all [[crowd control]]s from himself. For the next 6 seconds, he becomes immune to [[crowd control]]s and gains {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}. For the first second of ''Ragnarok'', he also gains {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} when moving towards nearby visible enemy [[champion]]s.
r1.name: Ragnarok
notes: * ''Ragnarok'' can be cast while ''Olaf'' is disabled by enemies but will not remove any active {{tip|airborne|displacement}} or {{ais|Tempered Fate|Bard}} {{tip|stasis}} (only future applications).
* ''Ragnarok'' will not bypass any allied disables ({{iis|Zhonya's Hourglass}} {{tip|stasis}}, {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}}).
* Abilities with debuff components ({{ai|Permafrost|Sejuani}}, {{ai|Chomp|Trundle}}, {{ai|Mocking Shout|Tryndamere}}) will not be negated by ''Ragnarok'' (only their crowd control ones).

* Against {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}}, Olaf can't break free from the area unless he has a blink or a dash during the active duration, this because the border of the Camille's ultimate is considered to be terrain for the affected champ.
